column4: hello ; with 64 bits Breezy where to get dosemu I mean with which repositry ; thanks
open a console, and type "sudo apt-get build-dep dosemu"
after that is done, you'll find a dosemu deb in your current directory
open your sources.list and enable source repos
however you wish to accomplish it
yes, now update your apt-get (reload in synaptic)
amd64 is not very user friendly when it comes to commercial or patented software
in your console, type "sudo apt-get build-dep dosemu"
in your terminal, type "sudo apt-get -b source dosemu"
then you have your repositories incorrect, for i just did what i'm asking you to do and dosemu came down just fine
it does not matter what distro you are using, the source will build on any platform. i am on a powermac
: can you mail me your "sources.list" in order for me to check what is wrong with mine (I do not think I can receive with Kopete but try first if not working dmoyne@tiscali.fr) ; thanks

: same problem with the example you have just supplied after installing this sources.list I still cannot see dosemu proposed I think I know the reason it may be in hoary then when you update in breezy you see it but it is a hoary package !!!!
it is in both hoary and breezy.
